The distance from the center of the hexagon to the center of the eighth sphere is $\sqrt{3} - r_3$.
The distance from the center of the eighth sphere to any vertex of the hexagon is $1+r_3$.
By Pythagorean theorem, $(\sqrt{3} - r_3)^2 = (\sqrt{3})^2 + (1)^2 = 3 + 1 = 4$, so $\sqrt{3} - r_3 = 2$, or $\sqrt{3} - r_3 = -2$ (not possible since $r_3>0$).
Thus, $\sqrt{3} - r_3 = 2$, so $r_3 = \sqrt{3}-2$.

$r_3 = \sqrt{3} - 2$.
